channel.title: Data Breach & Ransomware Aggregator
channel.description: Real-time data breach notifications from state registries, federal sources, and ransomware trackers

item.description:

item.title: Ivantiâ€™s EPMM is under active attack, thanks to two critical zero-days
item.description:
Limited attacks occurred prior to Ivantiâ€™s disclosure, followed by mass exploitation by multiple threat groups. More than 1,400 potentially vulnerable instances remain exposed. The post Ivantiâ€™s EPMM is under active attack, thanks to two critical zero-days appeared first on CyberScoop.
ğŸ“° Source: CyberScoop | ğŸ·ï¸ Type: News

item.title: How Can CISOs Respond to Ransomware Getting More Violent?
item.description:
Ransomware defense requires focusing on business resilience. This means patching issues promptly, improving user education, and deploying multifactor authentication.
ğŸ“° Source: Dark Reading | ğŸ·ï¸ Type: News

item.title: From Quantum to AI Risks: Preparing for Cybersecurity's Future
item.description:
In the latest edition of "Reporters' Notebook," a trio of journalists urge the cybersecurity industry to prioritize patching vulnerabilities, preparing for quantum threats, and refining AI applications,
ğŸ“° Source: Dark Reading | ğŸ·ï¸ Type: News

item.title: Chinese APTs Hacking Asian Orgs With High-End Malware
item.description:
Advanced persistent threat (APT) groups have deployed new cyber weapons against a variety of targets, highlighting the increasing threats to the region.
ğŸ“° Source: Dark Reading | ğŸ·ï¸ Type: News

item.title: Tenable Tackles AI Governance, Shadow AI Risks, Data Exposure
item.description:
The Tenable One AI Exposure add-on discovers unsanctioned AI use in the organization and enforces policy compliance with approved tools.
ğŸ“° Source: Dark Reading | ğŸ·ï¸ Type: News

item.title: 2026: The Year Agentic AI Becomes the Attack-Surface Poster Child
item.description:
Dark Reading asked readers whether agentic AI attacks, advanced deepfake threats, board recognition of cyber as a top priority, or password-less technology adoption would be most likely to become a trending reality for 2026.
ğŸ“° Source: Dark Reading | ğŸ·ï¸ Type: News

item.title: ShinyHunters Expands Scope of SaaS Extortion Attacks
item.description:
Following their attacks on Salesforce instances last year, members of the cybercrime group have broadened their targeting and gotten more aggressive with extortion tactics.
ğŸ“° Source: Dark Reading | ğŸ·ï¸ Type: News

item.title: Chinese Hackers Hijack Notepad++ Updates for 6 Months
item.description:
State-sponsored threat actors compromised the popular code editor's hosting provider to redirect targeted users to malicious downloads.
ğŸ“° Source: Dark Reading | ğŸ·ï¸ Type: News

item.title: Attackers Harvest Dropbox Logins Via Fake PDF Lures
item.description:
A malware-free phishing campaign targets corporate inboxes and asks employees to view "request orders," ultimately leading to Dropbox credential theft.
ğŸ“° Source: Dark Reading | ğŸ·ï¸ Type: News

item.title: Dark Patterns Undermine Security, One Click at a Time
item.description:
People trust organizations to do the right thing, but some websites and apps have user interfaces that ultimately lead to inadequate security for users.
ğŸ“° Source: Dark Reading | ğŸ·ï¸ Type: News

item.title: 8-Minute Access: AI Accelerates Breach of AWS Environment
item.description:
The AI-assisted attack, which started with exposed credentials from public S3 buckets, rapidly achieved administrative privilges.
ğŸ“° Source: Dark Reading | ğŸ·ï¸ Type: News

item.title: GlassWorm Malware Returns to Shatter Developer Ecosystems
item.description:
The self-replicating malware has poisoned a fresh set of Open VSX software components, leaving potential downstream victims with infostealer infections.
ğŸ“° Source: Dark Reading | ğŸ·ï¸ Type: News

item.title: Russian Hackers Weaponize Microsoft Office Bug in Just 3 Days
item.description:
APT28's attacks rely on specially crafted Microsoft Rich Text Format (RTF) documents to kick off a multistage infection chain to deliver malicious payloads.
ğŸ“° Source: Dark Reading | ğŸ·ï¸ Type: News

item.title: Default ICS Credentials Exploited in Destructive Attack on Polish Energy Facilities
item.description:
Polandâ€™s CERT has published a report on the recent attack, providing new details on targeted ICS and attribution. The post Default ICS Credentials Exploited in Destructive Attack on Polish Energy Facilities appeared first on SecurityWeek.
ğŸ“° Source: SecurityWeek | ğŸ·ï¸ Type: News

item.title: Open VSX Publisher Account Hijacked in Fresh GlassWorm Attack
item.description:
A hacker published malicious versions of four established VS Code extensions to distribute a GlassWorm malware loader. The post Open VSX Publisher Account Hijacked in Fresh GlassWorm Attack appeared first on SecurityWeek.
ğŸ“° Source: SecurityWeek | ğŸ·ï¸ Type: News

item.title: Russiaâ€™s APT28 Rapidly Weaponizes Newly Patched Office Vulnerability
item.description:

item.title: Hackers Leak 5.1 Million Panera Bread Records

item.title: Vulnerability Allows Hackers to Hijack OpenClaw AI Assistant
item.description:

ğŸ“° Source: SecurityWeek | ğŸ·ï¸ Type: News

item.title: Critical React Native Vulnerability Exploited in the Wild
item.description:
Albeit mainly considered a theoretical risk, the flaw has been exploited to disable protections and deliver malware. The post Critical React Native Vulnerability Exploited in the Wild appeared first on SecurityWeek.
ğŸ“° Source: SecurityWeek | ğŸ·ï¸ Type: News

item.title: RapidFort Raises $42M to Automate Software Supply Chain Security
item.description:

item.title: California city turns off Flock cameras after company shared data without authorization
item.description:
The cameras will stay off until the Mountain View City Council can discuss how to handle the matter at a February 24 meeting, Police Chief Mike Canfield said in a letter to the community.
ğŸ“° Source: The Record | ğŸ·ï¸ Type: News

item.title: CISA orders federal agencies to patch exploited SolarWinds bug by Friday
item.description:
CVE-2025-40551 carries a critical severity score of 9.8 out of 10 and impacts SolarWinds Web Help Desk (WHD) â€” an IT service management platform used by many large organizations to handle ticketing, asset tracking and other tasks.
ğŸ“° Source: The Record | ğŸ·ï¸ Type: News

item.title: CISA official says CIRCIA cyber reporting update is 'weeks' away
item.description:
â€œI think that we'll have some news on CIRCIA in pretty short order, in the next couple of weeks, hopefully,â€ Nick Andersen, executive assistant director for cybersecurity at CISA, told reporters.
ğŸ“° Source: The Record | ğŸ·ï¸ Type: News

item.title: Dismantling Defenses: Trump 2.0 Cyber Year in Review
item.description:
The Trump administration has pursued a staggering range of policy pivots this past year that threaten to weaken the nationâ€™s ability and willingness to address a broad spectrum of technology challenges, from cybersecurity and privacy to countering disinformation, fraud and corruption. These shifts, along with the presidentâ€™s efforts to restrict free speech and freedom of the press, have come at such a rapid clip that many readers probably arenâ€™t even aware of them all.
ğŸ“° Source: Krebs on Security | ğŸ·ï¸ Type: News

item.title: Happy 16th Birthday, KrebsOnSecurity.com!
item.description:
KrebsOnSecurity.com celebrates its 16th anniversary today! A huge "thank you" to all of our readers -- newcomers, long-timers and drive-by critics alike. Your engagement this past year here has been tremendous and truly a salve on a handful of dark days. Happily, comeuppance was a strong theme running through our coverage in 2025, with a primary focus on entities that enabled complex and globally-dispersed cybercrime services.
ğŸ“° Source: Krebs on Security | ğŸ·ï¸ Type: News

item.title: Investigation into data breach involving Blue Cross Blue Shield members could head to court
item.description:
Jonathon Ambarian provides an update on a breach previously reported on DataBreaches.net: In October, MTNÂ reported on a major data breachÂ involving customers with Blue Cross Blue Shield of Montana. Now, as a state investigation into the breach continues, the next steps could be playing out in court. BCBSMT, the largest health insurance provider in Montana, said... Source
ğŸ“° Source: DataBreaches.net | ğŸ·ï¸ Type: Data Breach

item.title: BD: 14,000 journosâ€™ personal data leaked online
item.description:
Observer Online Report reports: A major technical failure at [the Bangladesh] Election Commission (EC) website on Saturday exposed the sensitive personal data of approximately 14,000 journalists. The leaked data included National ID (NID) numbers, mobile phone numbers, and full application copies of media professionals who had registered online for accreditation cards and vehicle stickers ahead... Source
ğŸ“° Source: DataBreaches.net | ğŸ·ï¸ Type: Data Breach

item.title: When the GDPR is weaponized to shut journalists up, donâ€™t go silently into that dark night
item.description:
While Zack Whittaker and I work to finish up a report on threats security researchers and journalists receive, there has been more and more news about threats to journalists and journalism. The arrests of Don Lemon and Geraldine Fort for reporting on a protest in a church could easily be construed as an obvious attempt... Source
ğŸ“° Source: DataBreaches.net | ğŸ·ï¸ Type: Data Breach

item.title: StopICE Hacked: Names And Locations of Over 100k Users Were Sent to the FBI, ICE and HSI
item.description:
Thea Felicity reports: The anti-ICE activist app and website StopICE has reportedly suffered a major security breach, exposing the personal information of more than 100,000 users to US federal agencies, including theÂ FBI, ICE and HSI. Hackers said they accessed names, logins, passwords, phone numbers and GPS coordinates, and sent the data directly to authorities. One... Source
ğŸ“° Source: DataBreaches.net | ğŸ·ï¸ Type: Data Breach

item.title: Comcast agrees to $117.5 million settlement to resolve lawsuits over 2023 Citrix Bleed data breach
item.description:
Abraham Gutman reports: Comcast is one step closer to settling 24 class action lawsuits over a 2023 data breach that potentially impacted over 30 million former and current customers. A $117.5 million settlement agreement received preliminary approval from a federal judge in the Eastern District of Pennsylvania last week. Impacted customers would be able to... Source
ğŸ“° Source: DataBreaches.net | ğŸ·ï¸ Type: Data Breach

item.title: RINA Accountants & Advisors is creating $400K settlement fund to settle lawsuit over 2022 data breach
item.description:
Mark Emem reports: A US accounting firm has agreed to pay hundreds of thousands of dollars to settle a class action lawsuit filed over a data breach. According to the settlement administratorâ€™sÂ portal, RINA Accountants & Advisors will set up a $400,000 settlement fund to compensate victims of the data security incident that occurred nearly four... Source
ğŸ“° Source: DataBreaches.net | ğŸ·ï¸ Type: Data Breach

item.title: Threats: Results of a pilot survey on threats, and a new category on DataBreaches.net
item.description:
So Zack Whittaker (of TechCrunch and this week in security fame) and I were chatting about some of the many threats weâ€™ve had to deal with over the years â€” threats of litigation, criminal charges,Â and threats by criminals all leapt immediately to mind. Maybe one day, someone will create a bingo card for countries... Source
ğŸ“° Source: DataBreaches.net | ğŸ·ï¸ Type: Data Breach

item.title: Under Pressure: Exploring the effect of legal and criminal threats on security researchers and journalists
item.description:
â€œDissent Doe,â€ DataBreaches.net admin@databreaches.net Zack Whittaker, this.weekinsecurity.com this@weekinsecurity.com February 2026. [Download .pdf version] Key takeaways Three-quarters of respondents in a pilot survey of journalists and security researchers reported receiving one or more threats due to their work; one-quarter reported never receiving any threats. Overall, half of the respondents reported receiving at least one legal threat.... Source
ğŸ“° Source: DataBreaches.net | ğŸ·ï¸ Type: Data Breach

item.title: IA: Dallas County to pay $600,000 to security testers arrested in 2019
item.description:
Phillip Sitter and William Morris report and update on a case in Iowa where security researchers were arrested â€” for doing what they had been hired to do. Add this to any list of legal threats researchers face. Dallas CountyÂ is paying $600,000 to two men who sued after they were arrested in 2019 while testing... Source
ğŸ“° Source: DataBreaches.net | ğŸ·ï¸ Type: Data Breach

item.title: Ransomware attack compromised 377,000 peopleâ€™s Social Security and driverâ€™s license numbers from Texas gas station and convenience store chain
item.description:
Kurt Knutsson recently reported on a ransomware attack in September that affected 377,082 individuals. Gulshan Management Services, Inc. is linked to Gulshan Enterprises, which operates around 150 Handi Plus and Handi Stop gas stations and convenience stores across Texas. Gulshan reported the incident to the Maine Attorney Generalâ€™s Office on January 6 and provided a... Source
ğŸ“° Source: DataBreaches.net | ğŸ·ï¸ Type: Data Breach
